channel.title: Ubuntu paths to files
channel.description:
Been a LONG time since I have even messed with RSPS, let alone even asked for help on one, but this is confusing me. I have a Windows PC, and an Ubuntu PC. If i run the server on Windows, it has no problems, but, if i run it on Ubuntu, it cannot find the config files. Is there a special way to do paths on Ubuntu?
EX for what im talking about, when running on Ubuntu. [code=On Ubuntu] Started on port: 43594 Cannot find: autospawn.cfg [/code] [code=On Windows] Started on port:43594 autospawn.cfg successfully loaded. [/code]

item.title: Ubuntu paths to files
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Been a LONG time since I have even messed with RSPS, let alone even asked for help on one, but this is confusing me. I have a Windows PC, and an Ubuntu PC. If i run the server on Windows, it has no problems, but, if i run it on Ubuntu, it cannot find the config files. Is there a special way to do paths on Ubuntu?

EX for what im talking about, when running on Ubuntu.

Started on port: 43594
Cannot find: autospawn.cfg
Started on port:43594
autospawn.cfg successfully loaded.

Read full topic
